headline: Roomba maker iRobot files for bankruptcy, to go private after buyout
summary: Roomba vacuum cleaner maker iRobot said on Sunday that it ​had filed for bankruptcy protection, and ‌would go private after being acquired by Picea, its ‌primary manufacturer.  The company, which raised concerns about staying in business in March, filed for bankruptcy in the District of Delaware as it ⁠grapples with macroeconomic ‌and tariff-related uncertainties.  iRobot faces competition from Chinese rivals such as Ecovacs ‍Robotics, which offer advanced features at lower prices.

headline: He Walked Away From A $300K Finance Salary To Start A Business. Losing $200 Sushi And Ski Trips Every Winter Was 'Absolutely Brutal'
summary: After seven years in a high-paying finance role that looked perfect on paper but made him miserable, a 30-year-old finally quit. The job paid $300,000 a year, and came with a lifestyle full of fine dining, skiing, and status. But deep down, he hated it. From Paychecks To Pressure “No dramatic blow up, no big revelation,” he wrote in a recent Reddit post on r/Entrepreneur. “Just the quiet realization that I could not keep pretending I enjoyed it.” So he left. headline: How iRobot lost its way home
summary: iRobot survived three decades of competition, but couldn't survive European regulators killing its Amazon buyout. Now it's being taken over by its own supplier in bankruptcy court.

content.title: How iRobot lost its way home
